Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: I tend to stay at budget hotels when in London so as to have more money freed up for nice meals etc. The good points about this hotel is that the room was clean and the staff were helpfull. There are places where it does not quite meet the standard of other similar hotels. The bathrooms are cramped so that you cannot fit into them. I am used to basic breakfasts e.g just Coffee and toast but I have to agree with other reviews which states the french bread here is stale and obviously left out all night. I would stay here again but only if other similar budget hotels were fully booked, overall not bad but could do better.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Richie S
Reviews.Content: Just average. Nice and clean and very close to the tube station. Staff could be more helpful

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms and they stunk”
Reviews.Author: MikeTurner11
Reviews.Content: We arrived late with 3 heavy bags and no one from reception even helped us bring them through the doors and up the stairs. We then had to lug them up a billion flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ExeterFred
Reviews.Content: The twin on the top floor was adequate for our needs, very clean. The price of about £75 did not include a kettle. Very quiet as we were on the top floor Continental breakfast should include orange juice and not squash and a bit more butter and jam and continental coffee. Reception was very efficient and hotel was close to the tube. We wre on the fourth floor...I dread to think what would have happened in case of a fire as the roof escape was padlocked and the only way down was via the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “we changed the hotel after the first night”
Reviews.Author: Aga a
Reviews.Content: First of all our room was located in another building, at the top, dont even know which floor it was. Of course, no lifts. The more you climb the staircase gets narrow and narrow so with a luggage it's worse than a day at the gym. Breakfasts are served in another building between 7.30-9.30 so when the weather is bad you may get wet and basicly is not comfortable. The rooms r so small so u cant move around at all, we couldnt open the window. If u want to take a shower u need to wait for hot water half an hour or more. If u want to brush ur teeth u need to sit on the closet as the bathroom is sooooooo small. People next door woke us up at 7am as they were shouting. So I think u can find a better place to enjoy ur time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: St_yugi
Reviews.Content: Poor premises! Bad, expensive breakfast! No services! Ugly small rooms! Terrible sound isolation! Awful rooms' interior!

Reviews.Title: “Staying with kids”
Reviews.Author: K T
Reviews.Content: The only reason I would stay at this hotel again is for the location. That is the only good thing about it. We stayed here with our 3 kids and I didn't sleep a wink. We were in a building remote from the main reception where the main front door was often left unlocked by other residents. The decor was dreary and little better than any student occomodation I've ever seen. Our 5 bed room turned out to have 7 beds and so was cramped, the carpet was stained, bunkbeds in front of windows, leaking drainage in the w/c, tiny showeroom, incredibly uncomfortable mattresses. As for complimentary breakfast - the pieces of baguette were stale and the orange juice was cheap squash. Don't be tempted to save money staying here unless you are prepared to accept this standard of accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sofietravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not expensive and budget hotel, I got what I payed for. But how can other guests expect lift in a simple hotel when you know thats mostly old buildings in London and no space to build a lift. Mostly new buildings have a lift.. So choose newer hotel or hostel and you have it! I like this hotel as clean, loacation very central and I would like to stay next time once more here.. And well, to transport my luggage in 2. or 3. floor, I see as a fitness training for free and happen as well in Dublin, Edinburg, Paris.. Bathroom same size as in in many other budget hotels and was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Skyhooks2010
Reviews.Content: It was about what I expected. Unfortunately, I was on the third floor, and there's no elevator. The room was basic. I had a bed, a tv, a chair, a shower, and a small bathroom. One thing I have never figured out, is why all hotels have carpeted floors. They must be terribly hard to keep clean, so I guess they're not really clean. This room, though, had one of the most stupid things I've ever seen, though. The bathroom had a toilet and a sink, and the shower faced the room. So getting out of the shower meant stepping out onto the carpeted floor. No wonder the carpet in front of the shower was moist when I checked in. Probably always is. Seems terribly un-hygenic to me. I hate standing on wet floor, so I always stand on a towel after a shower, but I know not everyone does. Apart from that, I guess it's just fine when you consider the price. The bed was fine, which was the most important part. I always stay in the same area, so who knows. I might be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: cricketro
Reviews.Content: This March I was in London. Thanks to booking via a travel agency in Romania, I managed to get a good deal at Lords Hotel. 2 persons/4 nights/220 euros, breakfast included. Although the wi-fi didn't work (apparently there was a problem at the hotel, but somehow the reception had internet) and it was noisy when a group of travelers arrived/left, overall, it was a good experience. There was hot water all the time and the hotel also provided soap and towels. There was heating in the room. The hotel is close to Buckingham Palace (about 30 min walking) and also very close to two underground stops (Bayswater and Queensway).

Reviews.Title: “Would not advise Lords Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A C
Reviews.Content: It has definitely got much more of a hostel feel about it, and a crap hostel at it. I get its a cheap hotel but it provides no hotel features so I don't get why it doesn't say its what it is, a hostel! First it smells, old damp, not aired enough smell. Some of the reception staff were quite unfriendly. Better off sleeping in than having the breakfast, stale piece of bread and the worst cup of tea I have ever had. Although the guy serving was really friendly. We were put in the basement, which probably is the worst part of the building. It definitely smells down there and can hear all street noise and noise from tv lounge, a party going on for a lot of the night (again how is this classified as a hotel). Also paper thin walls. And no double bed, even though thats what we booked! Seemingly they have no double beds anywhere, but unsure what to believe. The room is not very clean. Blankets are not clean, sheets are clean however. Positive side it was cooler down there. Mattresses were quite springy. They need some new ones. Location is grand, handy for tube and areas around. Overall better off in a hostel and paying their prices rather than staying in this 'hotel'.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: SouthseaKate Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: First of all, finding Leinster Square was very difficult as it was not mentioned in my excellent guide book for some reason. We ended up at Leinster Terrace, quite a walk away, and had to knock on doors for info how to get there. You did not include the hotel's phone number with their address which was so annoying. The staff were friendly, but the shower room was beyond description. The loo seat dislodged each time it was used, and the room was hardly small enough to bend down in. There was a large group of youngsters staying there and they were making a loud racket until nearly 3am outside our window. The "breakfast" consisted of two chunks of french bread and a small plastic container with jam. It had obviously been put out overnight as it was very dried and hard. To sum up, good staff but overworked maybe, disgusting shower room but at least it was very clean, and a frustrating start to the break as we had no phone number for the hotel (they said it was down to you and not them). Such a contrast to the wonderful break I had recently at the Holiday Inn in Bath, booked through you, which was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, Superb location”
Reviews.Author: PangpangSingapore
Reviews.Content: We were in Southampton in June. We decided to take a taxi down to London and decided to book a hotel the day before. It was quite stressful as most of the hotels were booked. We wanted a hotel that is near to the underground and places of interest. Not too far from the main city. However we do not want to pay too much for it as we figured we would be out all day. We were half-decided on Lord Hotel but it seems to fit the bill. The photos in the hotel does not look inviting. Anyway, the 4 of us took a taxi early the next morning. We were given 2 rooms, one facing the road and the other facing the garden. The room facing the road (Leicaster St, I think) was bright and nice. The one facing the garden was a little dark. They provide basic breakfast. The bread was however a little too hard. We love this hotel for : 1) Location (near Queensway underground, near the Chinese restaurant that we love although I cannot remember the name now, love the morning jog in Hyde Park. and near to the shopping districts 2) Price of the hotel room was really reasonable 3) It is quiet and serene even though it is near to the city 4) Direct private bus from hotel to airport (need to book one day in advance) We do not like the hotel: 1) There is no lift 2) Too many doors leading to our hotel room 3) Service staff is just ok. You won't feel the warmth of their service 4) Seems to have a little musty feel and smell. However, after opening the windows everything in the room seems fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janice f
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for 2 nights in a family room for 5, which actually slept 6. The rooms were quite spacious and very clean. I was initially worried about this choice of hotel as I have 3 young children and read some of the older reviews. I can honestly say that I would come back here. Its very clean, and the rooms have been refurbished. There is no way I would let my children stay in a hotel that wasnt appropriate so please dont take too much notice of some of the previous reviews. Breakfast is okay to keep you going til lunch time, but would be nice to have tea/coffee making facilties in bedroom. The staff are very friendly and polite. Excellent location bang in middle of London!! No complaints from me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Good for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: incrocodible
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with a friend and we stayed in Lords hotel for 4 nights in June. We are not very demanding customers, so we were satisfied with the hotel. We knew that in London, cheap hotels have tiny rooms with microscopic bathrooms (ours was en suite), narrow corridors and stuffy floor-to-floor carpeting. We came to see London, not to spend time in the hotel, so we enjoyed our stay. Staff was very friendly and the breakfast nutritious. Safety box and locked room for luggage after check-out would have been nice, though. Wi-fi connection was available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Worst UK accommodation ever”
Reviews.Author: Emma_B_11_11
Reviews.Content: - No water kettle in any of the rooms, - Sub-standard breakfast: one small cup of tea or coffee only - not even a pot of tea! - now we know why breakfast is always included. Even purchasing something from the nearest food store and making tea with your own water kettle (if the rooms had kettles, which they do not) would make a better breakfast, any day! - No bedside lights in certain rooms - only one big light in the ceiling, - Noise outside and thin walls between rooms leading to noise (at all hours!!) from other guests! - Minimal bathrooms - gives you claustrophobia! - Horrible beds with springs that dig into your body as you lie down (and I'm not even overweight!).

Reviews.Title: “should be listed as a hostel..wouldn't go back if they paid me”
Reviews.Author: mrsnasri
Reviews.Content: room was clean but nothing like the picture on the website, had dodgy bunk beds and for breakfast a cup of tea that hadn't been shown a tea bag..on the up side, staff were friendly and it was cheap..however, i hope to never have to return to west london again let alone Lords

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says”
Reviews.Author: loobylou007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after a concert and wanted a place to rest our heads. Our twin room was very clean, the bathroom was admittedly tiny, but clean, had hot water and the shower did the job. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very basic continental, 2 pieces of french bread with a selection of jams, coffee and juice. We were able to leave our luggage after checkout whilst we explored London before getting our train home - we chose to pay Â£3 for them to lock away our suitcase securely, although they would have allowed us to leave it in a small room, not secured, for free. They charge a Â£10 refundable deposit for the tv remote control, which we didn't bother with as we weren't in the room for long. Overall, a good stay, and if you're looking for cheap room in a very convenient location (less than 10 mins walk from Bayswater and Queensway tube and 20 mins walk from Paddington) then I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money & nowhere near as bad as some reviews suggest - perfect for gig-goers”
Reviews.Author: Gig-goer84
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two single rooms for one night as we were attending the Arcade Fire gig at Hyde Park. As we were a bit last minute with our hotel search, this was the best we could find for a reasonable cost. We didn't really want to spend a lot as we were only overnighting as we were unable to get home after the gig. I was a bit worried about the stay due to the past reviews that I have read, as well as viewing the photos, however we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The rooms are small but as we were only going to be in the hotel for about 12 hours, this wasn't an issue. The ensuite is minute (the toilet and sink are basically in the shower cubicle) but again, for Â£50 and for a 12 hour stay, this wasn't a problem. The rooms are plainly decorated and basically furnished however, everything is clean & comfortable. One downside was the towels were handed to us after we were already in the room - the woman putting the towels out just walked in to my friend's room without even knocking, not aware that we had checked-in! We didn't eat the breakfast as we were quite hungover (eating bread rolls just seemed to be too much effort!), however we did go down for the included orange squash. I wouldn't really call bread rolls and jam a continental breakfast! The staff are really friendly and the hotel is very well located - quietly located enough without being too far from tube stations, food outlets, etc.... An ideal base for a night out but I probably wouldn't recommend for a longer stay as the ensuite being so small would probably get on your nerves after a couple of days! Perfect for gig-goers. Tip: don't pay for a TV remote! We didn't and we were able to change the channels on the side of the TV - as the room was small and we weren't spending a lot of time in it, I was happy to move half a metre to change the channel rather than pay Â£10!

Reviews.Title: “very good destination to visit london”
Reviews.Author: pjnags Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: not the best of hotels but the rooms were clean and a warm welcome and very good value.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuyogVM
Reviews.Content: The rooms were extremely small but for the price offered, we shouldnt expect more! Quite a cheap hotel with basic amenities. The breakfast was bad with absolutely no options! The staff was courteous and helpful. No lifts so you'll end up dragging your luggage for 3 floors if you get one of the topmost rooms.

Reviews.Title: “great little place”
Reviews.Author: smilie62
Reviews.Content: Cutest little room with lovely french doors; the bathroom was an amazing design for space-saving though I couldn't shut the door when I was sitting on the toilet :) It was clean and slept like a dream because the bed was perfect and they had super down comforters. Breakfast was simple, but filling (2 giant rolls w/jam and fantastic coffee). And the neighborhood is just lovely to walk around, with all sorts of restaurants, close to the underground, and is still quiet. I'd definitely give it an enthusiastic two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: navis84
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights in December. It was my first trip abroad so i was not expecting many things especially from the hotel. I just wanted fora a place to sleep and have a shower. And that's what i got. A very good and decent hotel in a very good and quiet neighborhood just 2 minutes walk from the nearest metro station! Firstly there is no elevator in the hotel but ok...it was a good way to exercise! :) The room was not very small...it was just what we needed. Bathroom was very clean but was more like a ship's cabin, and i felt a little weard in it, but there was plenty hot water. Typical poor breakfast was included, with orange juice, bread, butter and jam. The staff was very helpfull and kind. There is not much to see or do around the hotel, but it is a very quiet, safe and nice area, with one italian and a couple of chinese to eat, and of course a "Burger king's". I would certainly recomend this hotel for someone who does not want to pay a lot for the hotel. It was one of the cheapest i found when i went there, but one of the best of its type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised but more needs doing”
Reviews.Author: llcelsie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a group of french children and their teachers. There were a lot of other groups there as well, it was therefore very noisy at breakfast . This needs to be considered if you want peace and quiet. We stayed in the main building which does make a difference. It had obviously been decorated and refurbished recently, rooms were clean and basically equipped - did have a haidryer but no kettle in room. My main concern was the shower, it fills the bathroom and mine was potentially very dangerous. In the middle of my shower the water was suddenly scorching hot and it did not cool down - I was covered in soap with no way of rinsing it off. The sink did not have a plug nor was there any cold water in the tap. I was lucky, a teacher in the group got burnt. The temperature dial was missing and even though I reported this nothing was done. Breakfast was better than I was expecting having read the other reviews, yes it is basic and there are additional costs to upgrade it but the french style bread we had was fresh. It wasn't as good for the french children since they usually drink hot chocolate and the hotel would only serve them tea or coffee - they had to pay an extra Â£1 each. Some of their rooms had graffiti on the bars of the bunks and the bars themselves were loose - this has been mentioned before in a review but it has not been repaired.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to transport services.”
Reviews.Author: Marge033 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is as you expect for the price ,the important thing is it is clean and close to food chains and transport services.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient and clean place to stay in London”
Reviews.Author: usc2k
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, I almost canceled my reservation, expecting to find an insect-filled house of horrors. What I found instead was a perfectly clean and comfortable room, very friendly and helpful staff and a hotel that offered excellent access to the city of London. While this is definitely a not the Ritz Carlton, I found it more than acceptable for the price. The rooms are small, but having lived around Europe I didn't see anything unusual with this for the price. The bathroom is not the most comfortable in the world, but it's much better than a shared bathroom. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a centrally located hotel and would rather spend their money on shopping, theatre and dining than waste it on an pricey hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: emmoaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large room with 2 small children. Room was clean, service great. Perfect location for sightseeing in London, loved the park and Princess Diana Playground. Excellent value in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: peztherez
Reviews.Content: We also were put into the second building up the road, booked for myself, husband and our son. Got into our hotel and found 3 bunkbeds that when you leaned on them they were liable to colapse, felt it was safer to pull the mattresses off the bed and slept on the floor. What can i say about the bathroom, had to step up about a foot to get into it, couldn't sit on toilet without banging your hands on wall, sink. Also wasn't cleaned properly from the previous occupents as found burst balloons on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel!...”
Reviews.Author: AndrewandJenna
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the photos on the website as they dont show you the 2nd part of the "Hotel" which is situated up the road. This happened to us and our room was nothing like the photos shown. The room was a box with 2 small hard single beds and the bathroom which stepped up into the size of a small closet. For the price we paid ( 65 pounds per night) and the fact they called themselves a hotel we were very depressed at the basic style of accommodation. Alright if tht is what you are after, but you can pay a lot cheaper for the same or better accommodation. We had booked and paid for 3 nights but didnt even stay the first night forfeiting our payment.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book a room at Lords Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bodille
Reviews.Content: We had ordered and paid for the stay in this hotel through the Danish Travel Agency FDM Travels. But when we arrived the could not give us a room the first night. Were were asked to go to a hotel 20 minutes away. But only for the first nigtht. The next day we could be at the hotel, but they could not guarantee, that we could have a room in the day time. But were welcome to place our luggage in the hotel This spoiled totally the travel So I will never book a room in Lords hotel and will never more buy a travel through FDM Travel.

Reviews.Title: “Backpackers would be be happy, NOT for a family though!”
Reviews.Author: Kezzwezz
Reviews.Content: First visit to London, first hotel, this 'Hotel' (and I used that term loosly) started my holiday off on a very sour note. Beds as hard as a ROCK, Bathroom cannot really be called that as it was a cramped toilet with a shower nearly on top of it, you cannot turn around in it and your knees touch the door when you sit down! 'Continental breakfast' was 2 bread rolls with Jam and I paid extra for it!?! I did not find the staff helpful at all and the stairs where narrow and hard to get luggage up, reminded me of 'European Vacation' type hotel. NOT recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but charming and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: foxite
Reviews.Content: I wanted somewhere inexpensive to stay while I dealt with queries from the editor of a book of mine that will be published next year. For my purposes the hotel was fine, and I must put in a special word of praise for the receptionists. They were most anxious to be helpful, and were very welcoming. I notice that one of the adverse reviews complained about the absence of IT facilities. I needed IT facilities, and a receptionist explained how to get to an internet cafe ten minutes walk away - which served my needs perfectly. The room and shower-room were indeed small, but the bed I occupied was firm, and I slept well. Whether unusually or not, I had no noise problem at all. I missed the kettle and tea arrangements which are normal now in guest houses and hotels, and wasn't altogether convinced that the drinks machine was a substitute. But the tea was a respectable tea-bag, not powdered stuff, and I had no complaints about the quality of he drink. I suppose the coffee was instant, which is sad. The breakfast was very basic, but I don't normally eat much breakfast. Someone referred to bread slices: this is a libel. The rolls are good Italian-style rolls. My practice was to eat one with the tea and secreted the other in the paper napkin provided to eat later with cheese in Tavistock Square. I would not recommend the place for my wife, who is somewhat disabled and needs a lift. I would certainly mention it to any fellow-academic with a cheerful disposition who needed somewhere convenient to stay while using London libraries. Many of your visitors are evidently miserable fuss-pots.

Reviews.Title: “very basic very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: los_angelo124
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 days . The room, hotel and breakfast is very basic! but you cannot expect a lot if you don't pay a lot... i dont recommend for families.This is students accomodation only. one plus of this hotel is very friendly staff! welcoming and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “,”
Reviews.Author: lenyabila
Reviews.Content: the room was too small for 4 persons, small bathroom, did`nt work ,the shower i mean. The staff my gosh:( but bsides all that, the hotel is located near the subway, Near to the park, shops, bars and resturants near by..just 4min walking to the subway,

Reviews.Title: “Good for somewhere to sleep and that's it”
Reviews.Author: davecharlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. I have never seen a bathroom so tiny! There are no lifts, continental breakfast consists of juice and 2 bread rolls, you have to pay to get anything else, which isn't much better. We didn't bother going again. The only parking we could find was a ten minute walk away in a multi-storey carpark, (very expensive!). Staff were very friendly. If you plan on staying in your room a bit more than just somewhere to sleep, this will be a bit too claustrophobic. Good place to be for local restaurants and easy walk to Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “OMG - the staircase from hell....”
Reviews.Author: kevinnugent
Reviews.Content: I knew when I couldn't fit the suitcase up the stairs there was going to be a problem with the room size. We booked a Triple Room as my wife and I were sharing with our 4 year old. He loved the top bunk, but my wife was not impressed with the bottom single bunk and my 1' wide single bed with wire under mattress springs.... creak creak creak all night everytime someone moved! :) I understand we weren't paying for the Mayfair, and the location was absolutely brilliant but these owners are slum lords! I pity the poor buggers in there if there ever was a fire.... it would be impossible to escape from in time. Anyway, you get what you pay for here. Nothing but location...

Reviews.Title: “Just awfull !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GreeceMeli7
Reviews.Content: This is defenitely not a hotel!!!! Maybe a hostel and not a good one!!!! First of all we booked a double room to end up with a room with one bed and a bed up to another-I dont know how to say that in english,sorry..... The one bed was in teribble condition... We put blankets so to get sleep!! The bathroom,well what is that? Have you been to a ship before? Well is 100 % worst!! You just cant imagine. 2 people in the same bathroom this is not possible,just to give you an example!! We try to get some sleep but was not posibble!! The walls like paper and the hotel full of young people that were shouting and jumb on the floors all night!! We telephone the receptionist ,but only after 1 hout the problem solved-in a way.... The hotel has no heat!!! Do you believe that in London???? We were lucky enough that the weekend we went was not such cold!!! The breacfast?? Well that is a joke!! Juice or coffe ,you have to choose and just a slice of bread with butter and jam. For everything else you had to pay... And I can imagine how delicius would it be... Anyway,so much noise in the breakfast with all these childrens,we just couldnt stand!! The only good is the area.. I love Bayswater!!! its my 4d time going in this area.. Trust me!!! Find another hotel if you want to take some sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible. Please. This is not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: baribalbear
Reviews.Content: Definitely Lords Hotel is NOT a hotel. Maybe quite a few years ago... The building is old and tired. A considerable reform is badly needed. It seems like they are about to close and they are getting the last pounds they can before they collapse. Welcome: my double room was transformed in a six beds room (three bunks in the middle) with no place even to sit. They apologized because they were full, but I had made and paid the reservation two months in advance. After much complaining, they changed me the following night to a third class boat room with a submarine bathroom. But double room, at least... Breakfast was basic: orange juice or orange powdered water?? Old bread bums and cheap coffee. If you desired some luxury you had to pay for it (this includes milk... or cereals). Of course no lift. From the breakfast room to my boat room: Four high stores. We had to hire two "sherpas" to help us up. Summarizing: ItÂ´s a ratther cheap place but some teenage hostels deserve more stars and recognition, and at least you know where you are going. This is pure cheating. Something positive: Location near Hyde Park and Queensway.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: Sofiaraujo
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights in June. I booked it in advance and read a whole lot of reviews, some good and some bad, but overall good. I have to say that I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff were nice and the room was clean. The bathroom was cleaned every day, the sheets were clean (not changed, of course). They do not change the towels every day, but I agree with that, plus it's environmentally friendly. I don't change towels in my house every day, but you can have them changed if you want to at an extra cost (1/2 pounds, I think). I slept very well. The room is tiny and so is the bathroom, but I'd rather have that than share one, and considering the price, I would say it's a pretty good bargain. We paid extra to have an English breakfast and to be honest, I could not eat everything as it was too much. But my boyfriend did, so... Continental breakfast consists of two bread rolls (one of them whole wheat, which is great for us ladies), jam and butter, milk and coffee and orange squash (more cordial, but ok). You can have more things at an extra cost. We only went to the hotel to sleep and shower so it was perfect for us. That was the second time in London and the first time I also stayed in Bayswater. It's a lovely area, near Queensway and Bayswater tube station (5 min walk), Hyde Park, Portobello market and lots of restaurants. They also have outlet adaptors and hairdryers on request, which is great. I also needed a fridge to store my insulin, as I'm a diabetic and they provided that as well, no problem. Overall, if you're looking for a budget hotel, but insist on having a good place to rest, cleanliness and location , Lords Hotel is the place to stay. I'm going back this November and I've already booked there again. Sofia AraÃºjo Portugal

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: Caz2008
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for cheap accommodation in a convenient location Lords will suit you. Its one up from a hostel. Fairly clean, the rooms are serviced daily, don't leave your towel on the floor or its a 1 pound charge (they supply you with a new one). The bathroom was tiny but better to have that than shared facilities. The rooms are dated with a jumble of bunks and single beds. I liked it as Bayswater is a handy location, the tube is nearby as is a bus stop for the hop on hop off bus and Hyde Park. Don't get excited about the 'continental breakfast' as it is just two dinner rolls with jam, coffee or tea and cordial ('squash'). We managed to find a pub around the corner, the Black Lion with a 4.95 pounds full breakfast with coffee. Tescos and Spar are near there as well so you can buy supplies there. There's no bar fridge or tea or coffee making facilities but there was a tv and a phone. I also liked the fact that it was a secure building (we stayed in the building separate to the main building where you check-in). Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great ultra cheap place in the most expensive capital of the world”
Reviews.Author: nadiou
Reviews.Content: a very basic but brilliantly affordable place in the heart of london, close to beautiful hyde park, museums, happening portobello, what more could you ask and for Â£60 a night with your own shower. it is tired, but they are doing a great job with good staff at an incredible price. don't know how they do it, but they've been going for nearly 40 years, so the equation must work.

Reviews.Title: “The cleaning "ladies" steal”
Reviews.Author: maryNorway
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a good place to stay for cheap money. But that was until i found out that the people who clean the rooms steal. Im 100% sure that an item was stolen after they/ that person had been there. Its a very cheap hotel, and the owners hire cheap labour who are not trusthworthy. If you want to keep you things safe...dont stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JanL_8
Reviews.Content: Cheap, tatty, grimy, sleazy with the tiniest bathroom imaginable. It is like something out of Dickens - "Bleak House" is apt. The only saving feature is the location. This place was the absolute pits - and the low point of our visit to the UK. There is a spirit of meaness the proprietors convey - basic services, freely provided by other establishments are available at a cost. Very disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money. I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: woozysss
Reviews.Content: Booked the Lords Hotel less than 24 hours before i arrived for Â£50 for one night. Was the only hotel room in London I could find. Easy to get the bus from Oxford St and just a 5 min walk from the bus stop. Or just 2 mins from Bayswater tube. My room had bright wallpaper which I would rip off if I owned the hotel. It was not a huge problem. The room was small but very clear, I had a balcony, lovely view of the quiet street en-suite. Very small ensuite, the smallest I had ever seen but everything worked and I was happy. The area itself is great. Lords is on a quiet street but right next to Queensway and Westbourne Grove which have lots of restaurants, bars and shops. It looks a lot further on the map from anything then it actually is. Bed was comfy, I slept really well, no external or internal noise. Not the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed in but for Â£50 a night it was great for me for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Jessib
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really cheap for being London. I didnÂ´t expect much when i booked this hotel but i was positively surprised. itÂ´s nothing fancy but a clean, safe hotel with friendly staff. We were two people and got a big room with three beds. I have never seen a bathroom so small as the one in our room but it was in our room for not lots of money and it was clean. The included breakfast is not that great, itÂ´s coffe and breadrolls but you can get more stuff for a cheap price. I read somewere that the closest subwaystation is Queensway whitch is wrong, itÂ´s Bayswater. They are only one minut apart but i had some trouble finding the hotel because of that, but if you know it, itÂ´s easy. Next time i go to London and are not planning to spend to much time on the hotel i will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very Friendly, bit noisy in the morning”
Reviews.Author: moshimoshiexperience
Reviews.Content: We stay at Lords Hotel mid-march 2008, not in the main building, at 100 meters, no problem, much better. No elevators, very cramped stairs to reach our room at the 4th floor. The room was clean, not brand new but ok. Very small bathroom. The neighborhood is very quiet. The problem is inside. From 7h30am, you ear shower's noise, water sounds. Breakfast until 9h30am with bread, butter and jam. Avoid the orange juice, it's not a juice. Add Â£4 and ask the eggs and bacon. TIP: to avoid students groups have you breakfast from 9h. Location is great, 15min to Portobello market, Notting Hill and nice restaurants around (chinese, greek, japanese). Transports: bus stop around to Oxford street or the Tube Circle line stop Bayswater. TIP: use the Central line stop Queensway, more convenient to go downtown and no Circle lines delays.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Nortravel
Reviews.Content: On the time of our arrival, we were told that the hotel was overbooked and that we had to move to another hotel for the first night. This was the first negative experience. When we returned the next day, we got a room a the top floor, fifth i think. Of course no elevator, only an extremely typically narrow british staircase. The room was small, with two singlebeds, the floor leaned extremely, ant the bathroom was no larger than a little cupboard. The shower had almost no water. The dining area looked new, but the breakfast not much to talk about. The staff was ok. The hotel is located nearby everything; Hyde Park, shopping malls, restaurants and only a few minutes away from the nearest underground station. At the time of our stay, the hotel was filled with swedish students on a schooltrip, and there was noise all night through, neighbourhood itself wasnt to quiet either.

Reviews.Title: “IN A VERY NICE AREA and value for monay”
Reviews.Author: xr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lord's hotel for 5 nights on february 2007.If you CONSIDER THE PRICE and that we are talking about London it is a VERY GOOD DEAL!!! the hotel is clean enough but indeed old,if it wasn't so old i believe that IT WOULD COST DOUBLE ,because is in a great location! All the disadvantages i can recall comes from the fact that it is old. The room was good,pleasent and big,the furniture were nice and there was a tapestry on the wall from the 70's which i found very cute even though it was outmoded and old. The bathroom had HOT WATER all the time,it was small and even though it was clean it smelled a bit bad i think from the pipes or something like that. What i liked most was the location:NEAR 3 UNDERGROUND LINES,5 min.from bayswater(yellow&green)and 10 from Queensway(redline) Bayswater is A REALLY SAFE AREA with nice buildings and a lot of hotels which are more more more expencive than lords hotel. SO lords hotel is a GREAT DEAL that OFFERS THE GREAT LOCATION AND THE CLEANNESS!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, bit tatty, but clean”
Reviews.Author: DaveGCI
Reviews.Content: First impressions were that it was a grim place. Shabby carpets on the stairs and paintwork which left a lot to be desired. But the room was clean, the bedding spotless and the towels also clean. The graffiti on the bunk beds in the room was a little disarming. I found the room quite airless despite opening the window as wide as possible and the pillows were like rocks. But if you are looking for somewhere cheap to stay in London for a couple of nights, then this isn't too bad. And there are some pretty good shops and a decent cinema in the Whiteleys Centre nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: belginiangirl
Reviews.Content: I have to say that after reading some of the reviews, I was a little worried but I really didn't need to. We arrived on sunday at about 3 in the afternoon and he lady at the reception was really nice and answered all our questions. We were on the first floor in the main building (no lifts). We were a little surprised to end up in a room for 5 persons when it was only the two of us but the receptionist was fast in reassuring us that we wouldn't share. Yes, the bathroom is small but the water is hot is the pression is good too. They didn't change the towels but it was explained on a paper on the bathroom door. The room was very clean and we had extra blankets (even if we didn't need them). The only down sides are that the walls are very thin and you could hear the people next door. also, the breakfast consisted only of 2 little breads with jam and tea or coffe. But for the price paid, it was really reasonable! I would totally come back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a budget hotel in London!”
Reviews.Author: marycd1984
Reviews.Content: Im just back from 5 days staying at Lords. Its a great budget hotel in London! 2 mins walk (well lit with a few pubs so it feels a safe enough walk) from Bayswater Tube station which runs the circle line. Plenty of restaurants nearby and a convenience store within 2 mins walk. Hotel is clean and tidy. The hotel has 2 buildings, one with reception and some rooms, the rest of the rooms are in another biulding 30 seconds walk from the first. CCTV in both buildings. The second building (where i stayed) has a card lock on the front door so thats quite safe. Not sure about the reception buiding, but ours didnt have a lift. We were on the top floor so it was a bit of work getting up to it with luggage, but sure once it was up, it wasnt going down til it was time to leave! I didnt mind! Room was a good size for the two of us. Comfy beds, colour tv, large window, small ensuite and towels. Towels arent changed every day unless you request it and there is a Â£1 charge if you do. But we survived quite happy on one towel each! Soap is supplied but not shampoo, etc... no tea/coffee making facilities but paying Â£40 a night I wasnt climbing the walls at lack of services! I think some people are expecting the Hilton where ever they go, but for Â£40 a night, get real! As I said, the bathroom was very small, but lovely powerful shower with hot water. Extra blankets are provided, but we used them to boost the pillow height (home comfort!) Wardrobe and hangers, extra radiator though we didnt need it and loads of sockets for phone chargers, hair dryers, straighteners, etc...! Bring your own hair dryer! We spent Â£180 for 4 nights for twin room. Thats fantastic! Breakfast was included in that, but because it was in the other building, we didnt bother with it. No great financial loss was felt by doing that! I would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “NOT SO BAD FOR A BUDGET TRAVELLER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CristinaFirenze
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lords Hotel last March with my 9 years old son and a friend of mine with her son. I must say that after reading the reviews we were very worried about our staying there. Anyway, we wanted to try...Of course it depends on what you are looking for, but our experience wasn't so bad at all. It is true that the bathroom is incredibly small and the rooms are not huge and well furnished, and it is also true that breakfast is not the best, but the location is unbeatable. About 5 minutes walking distance from the tube and even less from the bus stop. Moreover our rooms were clean (unusual for budget hotels in London). Considering their rate, I would say this is a bargain. This was not my first visit to London and I've stayed in worse places (dirties, unsafe and not centrally located) paying more. I would stay at Lords Hotel again in the future and I would recommend it to people wishing to visit London on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Just for the position”
Reviews.Author: Bellatrix7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Lords Hotel in Bayswater London for one week..unfortunately! I payed 500 euros for a really small single room: it was about 2,5 x 4 metres. The bed was fit in the wall and the window and it was really noisy, as the wood pavement, the moquette was quite dirty and the forniture was very old. The desk had a broken glass top and all drawers were removed. You couldn't see television as people in the next room were walking or moving in their bedroom. The wardrobe had no doors.The bathroom was not a bathroom..it was a portable toilet ! I mean that in a very small area, similar to a shower one, you got a WC, a dwarf sink and a shower. And when you washed yourself you would obviously get all the "bathroom" completely wet! and what to say about the poor quality breakfast? Only two old and gummy rolls, some marmalade or jam and a glass of orange juice. A croissant? Â£ 1.20 ! A glass of coffee or milk? Â£ 1.00..Thieves! And what about security? Fire doors were woody and covered with very inflammable paint...is it safe? Receptonists and waiters never help you, neither if you travel alone and you are bringin a 25 kilos baggage! Stairs are very steep and tight. Be careful not to fall down! Also pay attention to your room telephones, because you couldn't sleep during all the night if there are school classes there for a school trip. The'll make it ring all night long! Something good about Lord's Hotel? the position 200 metres to bayswater tube station , close to hyde park and 4 kilometres to marble Arch. 400 metres to Queensway station. Served by Central, Disrict ad Circle llnes.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good value”
Reviews.Author: Kanerva
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lords for three nights with a friend for some fun and sightseeing. After reading the reviews here we were a bit worried, but decided to try the hotel anyway. We're glad that we did. Yes, the rooms aren't the prettiest and they do look worn down. Yes, the toilets may be the smallest on the planet. BUT: The price is below average in London, you have your own toilet, the sheets (and the room) are clean, you can lock your window (something that's not possible in many hotels in London that are supposed to be better than this one). On the negative side, the walls are like paper so voices from corridors and other rooms may disturb. The staff was great! Extremely friendly and helpful. I will stay here again and would recommend to budget travellers. I've paid more for worse hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “very very ugly room”
Reviews.Author: elessar
Reviews.Content: My first impression from the room wasn't that bad, but when I opened the door to the bath room.. The bath room was so ugly: every where was mould and it smelled very ugly. the bath room is also very very small and when you shower the whole room gets wet... We also got only one towel per person for the whole stay of 4 days. When I asked at the reception for a little towel more, they told us it costs Â£1 for each extra towel and they won't change the towels except for extra money... Afterwards we told them that the bath was very mouldy, but when they came to have a look at the bath, they only laughed and said that it wasn't mould, but it was for certain, you could even smell it. For the breakfast you only get 2 rolls, 2 pieces of butter and 2 of jam. You can also choose between orange juice, coffee and tea. The orange juice is very ugly and the tea is too strong. For other things like croissants, toast, milk, cheese, bacon or cappuccino you have to pay extra. You also have to pay extra Â£3.00 per piece of luggage to deposit it in the luggage room, in the lounge it is for free. For safe deposit boxes you have to pay Â£1.00/day. There is one more little detail: The hotel has 3 different houses which are about one street away from each other. I will never stay again in that hotel because it was too dirty for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “frozen in london”
Reviews.Author: netanya
Reviews.Content: very basic single room last decorated in the seventies. A plug in radiator was provided but there was nowhere to plug it in !. So a very cold night indeed. No soap in the very small bathroom either. no tea/coffee or water in room but tea/coffee drinks machine downstairs or buy your own in sainsbury's nearby. But that;s what you get when you pay rock bottom prices...you don't pay for the ritz and you don't get the ritz ! It's near marvellous moroccan and iranian restaurants and ok pubs and busy queensway If you want to stay in london and don't want to stay in a hotel room for long then this sort of hotel is fine..take a jumper in winter though !

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Janinalorens
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at Lords Hotel. The location is great, near to Notting Hill, Hyde Park and you are in Oxford Street in about 15 minutes with the underground. The staff in the reception and breakfast room is really friendly and polite. The room was simple but clean and warm. The bathroom is small but convenient. The breakfast included two pieces of bread, marmelade, butter, tea or coffee, juice. You can have more if you pay a supplement. This breakfast was enough for us, we didn't need to buy extra food. The area of Bayswater is very nice, lot of shops and restaurants. London is a very expensive city, we wanted a simple and nice place to stay, to sleep, have our breakfast and Lords Hotel was a good place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lords Hotel”
Reviews.Author: euro-j
Reviews.Content: We have been to London before on the cheap-side, always finding clean and simple accomodations. But LORDS HOTEL at Bayswater tube sta, was filthy, it stunk like pee, it was diplapidated, furniture broken, grafitti filled and poorly run and felt like a true fire trap. Paid $$ in advance for so-called English Breakfast . . a boiled egg smaller than the egg-cup itself . . AVOID THIS PLACE! The bad news is, it was actually recommended by easyjet site! I'd say, AVOID USING EASYJET hotel bookings.

HotelInfo.Name: Lords Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 20-22 Leinster Square | Bayswater, London W2 4PR, England
